page.title: 12BUCKIE AS A CARGO PORT
page.content:
BUCKIE AS A CARGO PORT - 1985
BUCKIE SIGNIFICANCE AS A CARGO PORT INCREASED CONSIDERABLY IN 1984. IN THE EARLY 198O'S CONSIDERABLE IMPROVEMENTS WERE CARRIED OUT TO THE HARBOUR. THE IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDED DEEPENING OF THE HARBOUR ENTRANCE AND THE FILLING-IN OF THE WEST BASIN TO GIVE AN EXTENSIVE STORAGE AREA WHICH IS LARGELY USED TO ACCOMMODATE TIMBER WHICH IS TAKEN TO BUCKIE BY LORRY AND THEN SENT BY SEA TO SCANDINAVIAN PORTS TO BE USED AS PULPWOOD. ANOTHER IMPORTANT EXPORT FROM BUCKIE IS PELLETS ARE A BY-PRODUCT OF THE WHISKY INDUSTRY AND ARE MAINLY SENT TO BELGIUM PORTS. OIL, MALTING BARLEY, AND SALT ARE THE MAIN IMPORTS INTO BICKIE. FURTHER IMPROVEMENTS ARE PLANNED FOR THE PORT TO ALLOW TIMBER SHIPS, CONT_
